response: "I can't keep up with everyone's expectations, it's overwhelming."
"Why does society define perfection and why do I have to fit into that mold?"
"It feels like I'm losing myself trying to meet society's impossible standards."
"I'm starting to question what is real and what is just a facade."
"I feel like I'm going crazy trying to live up to everyone's idea of perfection."
"I don't understand why I have to be perfect in order to be accepted."
"It's like there's a constant battle between who I am and who I'm expected to be."
"I'm exhausted from pretending everything is fine when inside I'm falling apart."
"I can't shake this feeling of inadequacy no matter how hard I try."
"Why is it so hard to just be me without feeling judged or scrutinized?"
